data.title: My Grandma’s Famous Mulligan Stew
data.meta_description: One of Our Family Favorite Dinners!. “My Grandma’s Famous Mulligan Stew” is published by Eliza Dub. in Click for the Crave.
data.text:
One of Our Family Favorite Dinners!

Eliza Dub.

·

Follow

Published in

Click for the Crave

·

1 min read

·

Apr 21, 2022

--

When we go to my grandmother’s house, this is a staple! This is one of my favorite dinners of all time and it only has 6 ingredients!

Enjoy with family, friends and new acquaintances!

Ingredients:

2 pounds stew meat

1 Tablespoon oil (optional)

2 (10.75 0z) cans tomato soup

2 cans full of water

5 medium carrots, cut into thicker slices

6 potatoes, quartered

4 ½ onions, quartered

Spices to taste (optional)

Preparation:

In a medium-sized pot with oil, brown the meat.

Add in tomato soup, water and mix.

Cover pot and let cook at a simmer (on about medium-low) for about 1 hour or until meat is tender.

Once the meat is tender, add carrots, onions and potatoes.

Let cook on a simmer for another 30 minutes. If the liquid starts to dissipate, add more water. If it is too liquidy, uncover and let cook until it thickens.

Serve hot and enjoy!

Makes 4–6 servings
